Posted By: WateryMind (5/7/2011 1:34:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I sincerely believe his mechanic is the way to show him as one of the most anciet/devastating planeswalker in game, and storyline.
  
   
Consider the fact he ensures you and your opponents that nothing is safe from him, that he can wreck your opponents plans (hand), crack their field (permanents), and if all else fails which he doent like, he pushes the restart button to your advantge.
  
   
Of course, th cost is high for him to do so, but as long as the option is there, the possibility of you controlling the battlefield to your advantage is assured, just don't be careless.
  
   
Hell, even the Eldrazi brothers would be useless if they got out late only to be removed, either by hand or more luckily, on the field.
posts.html:

Of course, th cost is high for him to do so, but as long as the option is there, the possibility of you controlling the battlefield to your advantage is assured, just don't be careless.

Hell, even the Eldrazi brothers would be useless if they got out late only to be removed, either by hand or more luckily, on the field.

Posted By: zarakstan (4/30/2011 3:23:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Amazing Karn (to the tune of Amazing Horse)  
  
Look at my Karn, my Karn is amazing!  
Check it on Gatherer  
(Wow... its rating is blazing!)  
  
With the points it can hoard, it removes cards from the board  
Then it brings them back again when I RESTART the GAME!  
(What... that's sucky!)   
  
Do you think so?  
Well, I guess I better not tell you  
Where the exiles go  
Sweet exiles!  
Mmm sweet exiles!  
Sweet exiles!  
Yeah, sweet exiles!   
  
Play me with Karn, I'll take all your cards  
And your rares and your mythics too  
(I think you'll find that all my cards pretty much covers everything)  
Shut up noob, play me with Karn!

Mmm sweet exiles!
Sweet exiles!
Yeah, sweet exiles!

Play me with Karn, I'll take all your cards
And your rares and your mythics too

Posted By: TheMurderousKitten (7/5/2011 12:07:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
His 2nd ability is awesome! It's like a spine of Ish with a Vindicate. And even better, you only pay 7 mana once, something you need Venser or alike to do with Spine. Sick in itself! Ult is Insurance and it slows down your opp or at least makes em' think twice about whatever they play. And if you combo him with Venser, he's pretty much safe keeping. I really like this card. He does so much and the fact that he's colorless makes him playable in almost any deck. He's going to redefine how removal is done for yrs to come in this game. Top 3 PW's for sure, arguably 2nd best.   
  
Isn't there a 0 cost counter card in an older set? Future sight maybe.. What happens if after the game is restarted, cards are drawn, mulligans are taken, but BEFORE exiled cards are returned to play, opp plays that counter card?? I wish I could remember the name of the card to make sure I have details right but assuming I do, that could get a little confusing..

posts.post_content: One doesn't have to exile Eldrazi and Blightsteels with Karn to win. Getting one or two extra lands is often enough to win you the restarted game. It is also more fun because the opponent will have a fighting chance, but the player who restarted has quite an edge.

Posted By: Kaizeischi (6/26/2011 5:20:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I pulled him in my work draft, and built and control deck around him. Simply devastating. I won the tournament handily, only losing one game that I got him on the table for (I think I got him out 11 of 20 times or so).  
  
Surprisingly I only used the restart once. I'd [Numbing Dose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Numbing Dose) or [Enslave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enslave) what I couldn't get with spell cancellation until I got Karn out, then just start exiling anything effective my opponent put out, or exile lands or what ever from my hand to charge up. He has potential in standard with control decks.
